TextAsset.value: (Tomari said he’d be in the library.)
(Wonder where he is.)
(Or if he’s hiding!)
(With an axe!)
(No, no. No. Don’t be ridiculous.)
(Just because he’s super intense, and a bit of a loner, and kinda weird doesn’t mean he’s an axe murderer.)
(But it doesn’t help his case either…)
Hey, ${slot:playerName}!
AH!
I mean, um…
AH wondered where you were.
(Good cover!)
(Keep thinking on your toes like that and you’ll get through this no problem.)
Sorry if I kept you waiting. We can’t leave any stone unturned with the threat of ten thousand years of darkness hanging over all of Namco Land.
Right. Yeah. That’s completely sane.
So, I pulled every book on advanced robotics in the library.
(Advanced?! What happened to basic?? I’m up debris creek without a katamari!)
Uh, super. Yeah. Maybe we could get a couple books on the basic stuff too though.
(Is there a Robots For Complete Idiots?)
Y’know, like a beginner’s guide. Or Baby’s First Robot. Something like that.
So we don’t, um, lose sight of the fundamentals, that is.
Hmmmm…
(I think he’s going for it!)
Ha, yeah, we should do that. We might lose our heads and forget to check the actuator fluid, or to lubricate the processor cores. Haha!
Exactly.
(I guess?)
That was a joke, ${slot:playerName}.
(Joke? WHERE????)
Anyway, let’s get started!
Oh, boy. I can’t wait.
${slot:playerName}?
Yeah?
You’re just standing there.
Am I?
Yeah. C’mon!
(Better follow him, I guess.)
(On the bright side, maybe I’ll break my legs before we get to the books!)
Okay, here we are.
(DARN MY STURDY LEGS! DARN THEM I SAY!)
To save time we should divide the books in two and then compare notes afterward.
Yeah. That’s what we should do.
Okay, I call this stack! Good luck.
Great!
(Maybe I’ll go blind and get to excuse myself?)
(Meanwhile, may as well get comfortable and crack open one of these books…)
(Wait a second.)
(This is a cookbook. Hm, must’ve gotten in with the robot stuff by mistake.)
(I’ll just quietly go to the next one in the stack. No reason to interrupt Tomari’s reading.)
(Uh, even if he IS holding his book upside-down…?)
(Whatever, he’s a genius. They’re eccentric like that.)
(Okay, next book in my stack is…)
(The Pictorial History of the Bridges of Namco Land County?)
(Isn’t there just the one bridge though?)
(Maybe not? I’m new here afterall.)
(Anyway, once is a mistake, twice is a coincidence. Next book will definitely be about robot engineering.)
(On the Reproductive Cycles of the Space Insectia???)
(Okay, what is going on here?)
Wow, ${slot:playerName}. You’re really flying through those books!
Oh, uh. Yup! That’s what I’m doing.
(Half of my books are on random subjects and the rest are cookbooks!)
(Huh. The cookbooks were all checked out by Richard Miller. About a hundred times each.)
(And then returned ten minutes later. Weird.)
(Anyway, none of this stuff is about robots! What gives?)
(Hooooooooold on.)
(Tomari’s still holding his book upside-down.)
(And it’s about breeds of horses!)
(Horses are almost never robots!)
(And he’s taking tons of notes!)
(It’s his GLASSES! He’s practically blind without ‘em! He has no idea what books he picked out.)
(Or what he’s reading.)
(Or what he’s writing down.)
(Or what I’m reading…)
(This could work for me!)
Yup. Makin’ all kinds of progress like crazy over here. How’re you doing?
It’s a little difficult to parse the relevant info from the larger framework of the central thesis.
(Uh-huh, I bet.)
Looks like you’re taking lots of notes though.
Hm? Oh, no. Just doodling in the margins.
But you’re not even looking at it. Your hand’s just going.
Yeah, it’s a method I employ on occasion. Gives form to the formless via the subconscious mind. It’s like, your conscious mind sees everything, but it doesn’t notice everything.
If that makes sense.
(Clear as mud, just like everything else he says!)
And doodling like this allows for the free form association of ideas to occur before rational thought can get in the way.
Mostly you get nonsense, of course.
Ah, yes, of course!
But every so often it can illuminate connections previously hidden in the shadows of the mind.
(Pretty sure this is how serial killers talk???)
Uh, yeah. I do that myself sometimes.
(Technically that’s not a lie.)
(But he doesn’t have to know that the stuff I doodle is, like, homework getting all rolled up by a katamari ball that falls off the edge of the world!)
(Really it’s just that I reach the edge of the paper though.)
Ha! I don’t think you need to use dumb tricks like that to get your brain working. You already powered through half a dozen of those advanced robotics books!
Uh.
Yeeeeaaaaaaaah.
Hey, you stopped doodling. Did you finish? Let’s see what you came up with!
Hm? I’m sure it’s nothing.
Yeah, it’s just a big blurry mess. See?
(What’s he talking about?)
(I don’t know the first thing about robot stuff, but he just accidentally drew up a big ol robot blueprint!)
(Freehanded!)
(Without looking!)
(With black ink on white paper!)
I’m just gonna throw it away.
Wait!
We can’t afford to waste time on useless stuff like this while the fate of all Namco Land hangs in the balance.
*IS THROOOOOWN!*
There. Gone forever.
(I think he thinks he threw it in the trash basket, but actually it’s a water fountain.)
(Sheesh, he’s as blind as a bat!)
(Anyway, I’m betting he misjudged those blueprints entirely since he can’t see them clearly enough.)
(I’ll just sneak on over there and grab the designs before they’re ruined!)
Hey, um.
Oof!
WHAT THIRST BE THIS?
(Dang, I’m a pretty good actor. Who knew!)
I’m just gonna go over there now.
To the water fountain.
Hm? Oh, sure. There used to be one around here.
Somewhere.
Uh, I’ll just use the one over there. Near the trash can.
And relieve it.
The thirst, I mean.
(Yeah! It’s totally working! He doesn’t suspect a thing!)
(Just grab those blueprints…)
(...Like so!)
(And then...uh. Hm. I could stuff it in my pocket if I had any.)
(I didn’t think this through did I?)
What’cha got there, ${slot:playerName}?
(Think fast, ${slot:playerName}!)
Uh, um.
(FASTER THAN THAT!)
It’s.
Uhhhhhhhhhhhh.
Nothing?
Don’t be silly. Anyone could see it’s a little blurry but very important.
(Darn it, how does a blind guy see so well!)
Well, it’s uh blueprints I kinda guess.
Yeah. I can just about make ‘em out from here.
Sort of a…
Robot, I’d say. A super robot.
(I guess he’s a little LESS blind at a distance.)
It, well, uh.
It is what it is.
It looks brilliant!
(Seriously? He doesn’t know he drew it?!)
I used to think I was a great inventor, but those designs of yours revolutionized my best work in a matter of minutes!
(Hrm, well, I kind of did. He would’ve thrown the blueprints away if it weren’t for me?)
(And if letting him think I’m a little more responsible for them than I actually am is what lets me hang out with Tomari a little more,
and to keep him out of trouble a little longer, and to maybe get to know him a little better,
and then spin it into a date or something once he finally settles down about this ridiculous ten thousand years of darkness stuff…)
(...then where’s the harm?)
(Right?)
Uh, yeah.
(WHY AM I PRETENDING TO BE THE ONE WHO DREW IT?!)
(Doing so can only get me into more wacky hijinks!)
(It’s the law of the stupid universe!)
We should take those designs to the garage to implement them straight away!
They’re your designs and well beyond anything I could’ve come up with. I’ll just watch and let you do everything. I’d hate to get in your way.
Eheh, uhh, no, you could help.
You SHOULD help!
A lot.
I mean, er, the best way to learn is by doing!
${slot:playerName}, I know you just don’t want me to think you’re showing off.
That’s really not it though!
Haha, ${slot:playerName}. You’re being much too modest! Let’s go!
(WAAAAAHHH!)
(His hand…)
(On MY hand…)
(Um. It’s kind of nice…?)
Without my glasses, I’m afraid I won’t be able to see the improvements you’ve made to my super robot.
(AH-HA! That’s how I’ll fake it! He can’t see a thing and I’ll just pretend to fix his robot.)
So, I hope you don’t mind talking me through everything you’re doing.
(I CAN’T WIN!)
Uh, y-yeah. Sure I can.

(Maybe when we finally get to the garage the whole place will be inexplicably ransacked, and Tomari’s super robot will be destroyed, and I won’t have to do anything because he’ll be too distraught for us to work on it!)
(Hm, no, that’s going too far. I shouldn’t hope for horrible things to happen to other people!)
(I’ll stick to hoping for personal crippling tragedies. Like…)
(Maybe my spine will spontaneously liquefy!)
(And then I’d have to go to the Nurse’s Office.)
(Problem solved!)
(Except for needing a spine to live.)
Hey, who’s that blurry figure of shadows?
Huh, wha?
He just came out of the engineering club!
Nyahaha!
Anyone who laughs like a vaudeville bad guy is up to no good!
He’s getting away!
Nyahaha!
And then he got totally away!
${slot:playerName}! The engineering club!
Oh no! You don’t think--!
I don’t want to say what I think.
He…
He took everything.
Not everything, Tomari!
Some stuff he just...smashed up beyond repair.
It had to be Dr. Kubota!
Or one of his agents!
Are you sure?
That Taira is a bit of a bully.
And there’s something about that Anti-Bravoman I just don’t trust!
No. It couldn’t be anyone but Dr. Kubota.
No one else possesses the breadth of genius to know which technologies to target.
Uh, they targeted everything though…?
We can still catch them if we hurry!
Where are you two going in such a rush!
GULP!
“Gulp,” eh? That’s troublemakers talk!
What?! No it isn’t! It’s not even a word!
Onomatopoeia is, by definition, a word!
Thought you were supposed to be some kind of brainiac, Tomari.
We haven’t time for this!
Hm, yes, rushing. Another telltale sign of the troublemaker.
I can’t see into the future.
Not yet anyway.
So, I can’t know where you’re going.
But I can see where you came FROM!
And it’s the engineering club room.
And what’s this???
It’s been completely ransacked and then also destroyed a little in some parts!
Surely you can’t think we did it!
No, I don’t think you did it.
I KNOW YOU MUST HAVE DONE IT!
WHAT?!
It wasn’t us! It was the shadowy figure!
The shadowy figure, eh?
Am I to believe this ALLEGED shadowy figure is an agent from Evil Namco High...
who was sent here by your arch nemesis to destroy everything you’ve done in the engineering club...
to set into motion events that will inevitably plunge all of Namco Land into a ten thousand year long reign of darkness?
(Wow, maybe Tomari really was on to something…)
Yes, that! It’s exactly that!
After all this time, and all my warnings, someone finally gets it!
HAW! WRONG.
I just made all that up. It’s pure crazy talk.
And that’s how I know you kids are lying.
Why would we destroy our own work?!?
If you’re asking me to understand what drives troublemakers to indulge in their various debaucheries, then you’re barking up the wrong guy.
There’s only one place for the likes of you.
THE GRAVE!!!
(WHAT?!?)
But that’s not until you die eventually.
Probably a long time from now. Until then you’ll be in Secret Detention.
What’s so secret about it?
Every moment of your life will be transformed into a detention...
...OF THE SOUL.
(Is that even legal?!?!)
(Or possible?)
But we didn’t do anything wrong!
${slot:playerName}, tell him!
Tomari’s right!
Yeah? Then what’s this!
(The blueprints! He grabbed them right out of my hand with principal swiftness!)
Hmm. Looks like plans.
BLUE plans.
Most likely blue sabotage plans.
No, no, no! They’re for the engineering club’s super robot and I--
Sorry, kids. I don’t speak DETENTIONESE.
Not fluently anyway.
